timeline.bodyText:
Is this the setting that determines the time of activity before the modal appears? Should that setting be stored with the SESSION_WARNING value so they are both in the same place and configurable?
Also, I tried changing this to 60 and it still took a looong time for the modal to appear, seemingly more than a minute. Not sure why.
timeline.author: wooldridge

replies.bodyText: Max session time is how long the session is in seconds. Default is 300 = 5 mins. There's an endpoint call where I get the session time for the server. Changing it to 60 won't do anything, because the maxSession time gets overwritten with the server parameter.
replies.author: brucean52

replies.bodyText: If that value is getting overwritten by the value received from the server, don't worry about storing a configurable version as I suggested.
replies.author: wooldridge

timeline.bodyText:
Can you specify what measure this is? I'm assuming seconds.
Also, this seems to be the modal countdown value? In which case "Start of countdown value in Session Timeout modal" is probably a more accurate description? Inactivity time before session warning appears is maxSessionTime? The measure for that (seconds) should also be noted.
timeline.author: wooldridge

replies.bodyText: Yeah, this is the time (30s) when the modal will appear and the countdown will begin. I'll rename it to something like SESSION_WARNING_COUNTDOWN
replies.author: brucean52

replies.bodyText: That renaming sounds good to me.
replies.author: wooldridge
